intro: Cyrtandra waiheae, commonly known as the Waihean cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant is typically found growing in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
